subject: Re: [junit] Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?

Subject: Re: [junit] Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=282027414; y=JhZvL6AcO9fT9KVwXSlNF4LjcCgNMoTvq4YHidHkuImYHbk

David Saff wrote:
> 
> 
> On 2/23/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@... 
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
>  > David Saff wrote:
>  > > Let me turn the question around: what would be the difference between
>  > > a method marked @BeforeClass @Ignore, and one with no annotations?
>  >
>  > I imagine it's the same as the difference between a method marked @Test
>  > @Ignore and one with no annotations, except that I imagine the test
>  > runner doesn't notify you "I skipped this setup method because you asked
>  > me to."
> 
> Is there any difference left? I don't think so, and that's why my
> initial reaction is that supporting @BeforeClass @Ignore would be more
> confusing than helpful. Thanks,

Well, why support ignoring tests and not setup or teardown? Understand 
that I don't care about support for ignoring tests myself, but since 
it's out there, why not extend the "ignore" feature to setup? If there's 
a good reason not to, then don't; but if not, what does that mean? 
Should we remove ignoring tests or add ignoring setup?

Take care.
